t: Amos 1

The*p words of Amos, who was among the shepherds of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
Judgment on Israel’s Neighbors
And*p he said: “The*pn Lord*s roars from Zion and*ld utters his voice from Jerusalem; the*ln pastures of the shepherds mourn, and*ld the top of Carmel withers.”
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Damascus, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln they have threshed Gilead with*ld threshing sledges of iron.
So*ln I will send a fire upon the house of Hazael, and*ld it shall devour the strongholds of Ben-hadad.

I*ln will break the gate-bar of Damascus, and*ld cut off the inhabitants from the Valley of Aven, and*ln him who holds the scepter from Beth-eden; and*ld the people of Syria shall go into exile to Kir,” says*l the Lord.*s
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Gaza, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln they carried into exile a whole people to*ld deliver them up to Edom.
So*ln I will send a fire upon the wall of Gaza, and*ld it shall devour her strongholds.

I*ln will cut off the inhabitants from Ashdod, and*ld him who holds the scepter from Ashkelon; I*ln will turn my hand against Ekron, and*ld the remnant of the Philistines shall perish,” says*l the Lord God.*s

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Tyre, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln they delivered up a whole people to Edom, and*ld did not remember the covenant of brotherhood.
So*ln I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre, and*ld it shall devour her strongholds.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Edom, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln he pursued his brother with the sword and*ld cast off all pity, and*ln his anger tore perpetually, and*ld he kept his wrath forever.
So*ln I will send a fire upon Teman, and*ld it shall devour the strongholds of Bozrah.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of the Ammonites, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln they have ripped open pregnant women in Gilead, that*ld they might enlarge their border.
So*ln I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and*ld it shall devour her strongholds, with*ln shouting on the day of battle, with*ld a tempest in the day of the whirlwind;
and*ln their king shall go into exile, he*ld and his princes together,” says*l the Lord.*s
Amos 2
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Moab, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln he burned to lime the*ld bones of the king of Edom.
So*ln I will send a fire upon Moab, and*ld it shall devour the strongholds of Kerioth, and*ln Moab shall die amid uproar, amid*ld shouting and the sound of the trumpet;
I*ln will cut off the ruler from its midst, and*ld will kill all its princes with him,” says*l the Lord.*s
Judgment on Judah

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Judah, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln they have rejected the law of the Lord,*s and*ld have not kept his statutes, but*ln their lies have led them astray, those*ld after which their fathers walked.
So*ln I will send a fire upon Judah, and*ld it shall devour the strongholds of Jerusalem.”
Judgment on Israel

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Israel, and*ld for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because*ln they sell the righteous for silver, and*ld the needy for a pair of sandals—
those*ln who trample the head of the poor into the dust of the earth and*ld turn aside the way of the afflicted; a*ln man and his father go in to the same girl, so*ld that my holy name is profaned;
they*ln lay themselves down beside every altar on*ld garments taken in pledge, and*ln in the house of their God they drink the*ld wine of those who have been fined.

“Yet*pn it was I who destroyed the Amorite before them, whose*ld height was like the height of the cedars and*ld who was as strong as the oaks; I*ln destroyed his fruit above and*ld his roots beneath.
Also*ln it was I who brought you up out of the land of Egypt and*ld led you forty years in the wilderness, to*ld possess the land of the Amorite.
And*ln I raised up some of your sons for prophets, and*ld some of your young men for Nazirites. Is*ld it not indeed so, O people of Israel?” declares*l the Lord.*s
“But*pn you made the Nazirites drink wine, and*ld commanded the prophets, saying,*ld ‘You shall not prophesy.’
“Behold,*pn I will press you down in your place, as*ld a cart full of sheaves presses down.
Flight*ln shall perish from the swift, and*ld the strong shall not retain his strength, nor*ld shall the mighty save his life;
he*ln who handles the bow shall not stand, and*ld he who is swift of foot shall not save himself, nor*ld shall he who rides the horse save his life;
and*ln he who is stout of heart among the mighty shall*ld flee away naked in that day,” declares*l the Lord.*s
Amos 3
Israel’s Guilt and Punishment
Hear*p this word that the Lord*s has spoken against you, O people of Israel, against the whole family that I brought up out of the land of Egypt:
“You*pn only have I known of*ld all the families of the earth; therefore*ln I will punish you for*ld all your iniquities.
“Do*pn two walk together, unless*ld they have agreed to meet?
Does*ln a lion roar in the forest, when*ld he has no prey? Does*ln a young lion cry out from his den, if*ld he has taken nothing?
Does*ln a bird fall in a snare on the earth, when*ld there is no trap for it? Does*ln a snare spring up from the ground, when*ld it has taken nothing?
Is*ln a trumpet blown in a city, and*ld the people are not afraid? Does*ln disaster come to a city, unless*ld the Lord*s has done it?
“For*pn the Lord God*s does nothing without*ld revealing his secret to*ld his servants the prophets.
The*ln lion has roared; who*ld will not fear? The*ln Lord God*s has spoken; who*ld can but prophesy?”

Proclaim*pn to the strongholds in Ashdod and*ld to the strongholds in the land of Egypt, and*ln say, “Assemble yourselves on the mountains of Samaria, and*ld see the great tumults within her, and*ld the oppressed in her midst.”
“They*ln do not know how to do right,” declares the Lord,*s “those*ld who store up violence and robbery in their strongholds.”
Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “An*pn adversary shall surround the land and*ld bring down your defenses from you, and*ld your strongholds shall be plundered.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “As the shepherd rescues from the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear, so shall the people of Israel who dwell in Samaria be rescued, with the corner of a couch and part of a bed.
“Hear,*pn and testify against the house of Jacob,” declares*ld the Lord God,*s the God of hosts,
“that*ln on the day I punish Israel for his transgressions, I*ld will punish the altars of Bethel, and*ln the horns of the altar shall be cut off and*ld fall to the ground.
I*ln will strike the winter house along with the summer house, and*ld the houses of ivory shall perish, and*ln the great houses shall come to an end,” declares*l the Lord.*s
Amos 4
“Hear*pn this word, you cows of Bashan, who*ld are on the mountain of Samaria, who*ln oppress the poor, who crush the needy, who*ld say to your husbands, ‘Bring, that we may drink!’
The*ln Lord God*s has sworn by his holiness that,*ld behold, the days are coming upon you, when*ln they shall take you away with hooks, even*ld the last of you with fishhooks.
And*ln you shall go out through the breaches, each*ld one straight ahead; and*ld you shall be cast out into Harmon,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“Come*pn to Bethel, and transgress; to*ld Gilgal, and multiply transgression; bring*ln your sacrifices every morning, your*ld tithes every three days;
offer*ln a sacrifice of thanksgiving of that which is leavened, and*ld proclaim freewill offerings, publish them; for*ld so you love to do, O people of Israel!” declares*l the Lord God.*s
Israel Has Not Returned to the Lord
“I*pn gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and*ld lack of bread in all your places, yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s

“I*pn also withheld the rain from you when*ld there were yet three months to the harvest; I*ln would send rain on one city, and*ld send no rain on another city; one*ln field would have rain, and*ld the field on which it did not rain would wither;
so*ln two or three cities would wander to another city to*ld drink water, and would not be satisfied; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“I*pn struck you with blight and mildew; your*ld many gardens and your vineyards, your*ld fig trees and your olive trees the locust devoured; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s

“I*pn sent among you a pestilence after the manner of Egypt; I*ld killed your young men with the sword, and*ln carried away your horses, and*ld I made the stench of your camp go up into your nostrils; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“I*pn overthrew some of you, as*ld when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and*ld you were as a brand plucked out of the burning; yet*ln you did not return to me,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“Therefore*pn thus I will do to you, O Israel; because*ld I will do this to you, prepare*ld to meet your God, O Israel!”

For*pn behold, he who forms the mountains and creates the wind, and*ld declares to man what is his thought, who*ln makes the morning darkness, and*ld treads on the heights of the earth— the*ld Lord,*s the God of hosts, is his name!
Amos 5
Seek the Lord and Live
Hear*p this word that I take up over you in lamentation, O house of Israel:
“Fallen,*pn no more to rise, is*ld the virgin Israel; forsaken*ln on her land, with*ld none to raise her up.”
For*p thus says the Lord God:*s “The*pn city that went out a thousand shall*ld have a hundred left, and*ln that which went out a hundred shall*ld have ten left to*ld the house of Israel.”
For*p thus says the Lord*s to the house of Israel: “Seek*pn me and live;
but*ld do not seek Bethel, and*ln do not enter into Gilgal or*ld cross over to Beersheba; for*ln Gilgal shall surely go into exile, and*ld Bethel shall come to nothing.”
Seek*pn the Lord*s and live, lest*ld he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and*ld it devour, with none to quench it for Bethel,
O*ln you who turn justice to wormwood and*ld cast down righteousness to the earth!

He*pn who made the Pleiades and Orion, and*ld turns deep darkness into the morning and*ld darkens the day into night, who*ln calls for the waters of the sea and*ld pours them out on the surface of the earth, the*ln Lord*s is his name;
who*ln makes destruction flash forth against the strong, so*ld that destruction comes upon the fortress.
They*pn hate him who reproves in the gate, and*ld they abhor him who speaks the truth.

Therefore*ln because you trample on the poor and*ld you exact taxes of grain from him, you*ln have built houses of hewn stone, but*ld you shall not dwell in them; you*ln have planted pleasant vineyards, but*ld you shall not drink their wine.
For*ln I know how many are your transgressions and*ld how great are your sins— you*ln who afflict the righteous, who take a bribe, and*ld turn aside the needy in the gate.
Therefore*ln he who is prudent will keep silent in such a time, for*ld it is an evil time.
Seek*pn good, and not evil, that*ld you may live; and*ln so the Lord,*s the God of hosts, will be with you, as*ld you have said.
Hate*ln evil, and love good, and*ld establish justice in the gate; it*ln may be that the Lord,*s the God of hosts, will*ld be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore*p thus says the Lord,*s the God of hosts, the Lord: “In*pn all the squares there shall be wailing, and*ld in all the streets they shall say, ‘Alas! Alas!’ They*ln shall call the farmers to mourning and*ld to wailing those who are skilled in lamentation,
and*ln in all vineyards there shall be wailing, for*ld I will pass through your midst,” says*l the Lord.*s
Let Justice Roll Down
Woe*pn to you who desire the day of the Lord!*s Why*ld would you have the day of the Lord?*s It*ln is darkness, and not light,
as*ld if a man fled from a lion, and*ld a bear met him, or*ln went into the house and leaned his hand against the wall, and*ld a serpent bit him.
Is*ln not the day of the Lord*s darkness, and not light, and*ld gloom with no brightness in it?
“I*pn hate, I despise your feasts, and*ld I take no delight in your solemn assemblies.
Even*ln though you offer me your burnt offerings and grain offerings, I*ld will not accept them; and*ln the peace offerings of your fattened animals, I*ld will not look upon them.
Take*ln away from me the noise of your songs; to*ld the melody of your harps I will not listen.
But*ln let justice roll down like waters, and*ld righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.
“Did*p you bring to me sacrifices and offerings during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
You shall take up Sikkuth your king, and Kiyyun your star-god— your images that you made for yourselves,
and I will send you into exile beyond Damascus,” says the Lord,*s whose name is the God of hosts.
Amos 6
Woe to Those at Ease in Zion
“Woe*pn to those who are at ease in Zion, and*ld to those who feel secure on the mountain of Samaria, the*ln notable men of the first of the nations, to*ld whom the house of Israel comes!

Pass*ln over to Calneh, and see, and*ld from there go to Hamath the great; then*ld go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are*ln you better than these kingdoms? Or*ld is their territory greater than your territory,
O*ln you who put far away the day of disaster and*ld bring near the seat of violence?
“Woe*pn to those who lie on beds of ivory and*ld stretch themselves out on their couches, and*ln eat lambs from the flock and*ld calves from the midst of the stall,
who*ln sing idle songs to the sound of the harp and*ld like David invent for themselves instruments of music,
who*ln drink wine in bowls and*ld anoint themselves with the finest oils, but*ld are not grieved over the ruin of Joseph!
Therefore*ln they shall now be the first of those who go into exile, and*ld the revelry of those who stretch themselves out shall pass away.”
The*p Lord God*s has sworn by himself, declares the Lord,*s the God of hosts: “I*pn abhor the pride of Jacob and*ld hate his strongholds, and*ld I will deliver up the city and all that is in it.”
And*p if ten men remain in one house, they shall die.

And when one’s relative, the one who anoints him for burial, shall take him up to bring the bones out of the house, and shall say to him who is in the innermost parts of the house, “Is there still anyone with you?” he shall say, “No”; and he shall say, “Silence! We must not mention the name of the Lord.”*s
For*pn behold, the Lord*s commands, and*ld the great house shall be struck down into fragments, and*ld the little house into bits.
Do*ln horses run on rocks? Does*ld one plow there with oxen? But*ln you have turned justice into poison and*ld the fruit of righteousness into wormwood—
you*ln who rejoice in Lo-debar, who*ld say, “Have we not by our own strength captured*ld Karnaim for ourselves?”
“For*ln behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O*ld house of Israel,” declares the Lord,*s the God of hosts; “and*ln they shall oppress you from Lebo-hamath to*ld the Brook of the Arabah.”
Amos 7
Warning Visions
This*p is what the Lord God*s showed me: behold, he was forming locusts when the latter growth was just beginning to sprout, and behold, it was the latter growth after the king’s mowings.
When they had finished eating the grass of the land, I said, “O*pn Lord God,*s please forgive! How*ld can Jacob stand? He*ld is so small!”
The*ln Lord*s relented concerning this: “It*ld shall not be,” said the Lord.*s
This*p is what the Lord God*s showed me: behold, the Lord God*s was calling for a judgment by fire, and it devoured the great deep and was eating up the land.
Then I said, “O*pn Lord God,*s please cease! How*ld can Jacob stand? He*ld is so small!”
The*ln Lord*s relented concerning this: “This*ld also shall not be,” said the Lord God.*s
This*p is what he showed me: behold, the Lord was standing beside a wall built with a plumb line, with a plumb line in his hand.

And the Lord*s said to me, “Amos, what do you see?” And I said, “A plumb line.” Then the Lord said, “Behold,*pn I am setting a plumb line in*ld the midst of my people Israel; I*ld will never again pass by them;
the*ln high places of Isaac shall be made desolate, and*ld the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste, and*ld I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.”
Amos Accused
Then*p Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel. The land is not able to bear all his words.
For thus Amos has said, “‘Jeroboam*pn shall die by the sword, and*ld Israel must go into exile away*ld from his land.’”
And*p Amaziah said to Amos, “O seer, go, flee away to the land of Judah, and eat bread there, and prophesy there,
but never again prophesy at Bethel, for it is the king’s sanctuary, and it is a temple of the kingdom.”
Then*p Amos answered and said to Amaziah, “I was no prophet, nor a prophet’s son, but I was a herdsman and a dresser of sycamore figs.
But the Lord*s took me from following the flock, and the Lord*s said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to my people Israel.’
Now therefore hear the word of the Lord.*s “You*pn say, ‘Do not prophesy against Israel, and*ld do not preach against the house of Isaac.’

Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s “‘Your*pn wife shall be a prostitute in the city, and*ld your sons and your daughters shall fall by the sword, and*ld your land shall be divided up with a measuring line; you*ln yourself shall die in an unclean land, and*ld Israel shall surely go into exile away from its land.’”
Amos 8
The Coming Day of Bitter Mourning
This*p is what the Lord God*s showed me: behold, a basket of summer fruit.
And he said, “Amos, what do you see?” And I said, “A basket of summer fruit.” Then the Lord*s said to me, “The*pn end has come upon my people Israel; I*ld will never again pass by them.
The*ln songs of the temple shall become wailings in that day,” declares*l the Lord God.*s “So*ln many dead bodies!” “They*ln are thrown everywhere!” “Silence!”*ln
Hear*pn this, you who trample on the needy and*ld bring the poor of the land to an end,

saying,*ln “When will the new moon be over, that*ld we may sell grain? And*ln the Sabbath, that*ld we may offer wheat for sale, that*ln we may make the ephah small and the shekel great and*ld deal deceitfully with false balances,
that*ln we may buy the poor for silver and*ld the needy for a pair of sandals and*ld sell the chaff of the wheat?”
The*pn Lord*s has sworn by the pride of Jacob: “Surely*ln I will never forget any of their deeds.
Shall*ln not the land tremble on this account, and*ld everyone mourn who dwells in it, and*ln all of it rise like the Nile, and*ld be tossed about and sink again, like the Nile of Egypt?”
“And*pn on that day,” declares the Lord God,*s “I*ld will make the sun go down at noon and*ld darken the earth in broad daylight.

I*ln will turn your feasts into mourning and*ld all your songs into lamentation; I*ln will bring sackcloth on every waist and*ld baldness on every head; I*ln will make it like the mourning for an only son and*ld the end of it like a bitter day.
“Behold,*pn the days are coming,” declares the Lord God,*s “when*ld I will send a famine on the land— not*ln a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water, but*ld of hearing the words of the Lord.*s
They*ln shall wander from sea to sea, and*ld from north to east; they*ln shall run to and fro, to seek the word of the Lord,*s but*ld they shall not find it.
“In*pn that day the lovely virgins and the young men shall*ld faint for thirst.
Those*ln who swear by the Guilt of Samaria, and*ld say, ‘As your god lives, O Dan,’ and,*ln ‘As the Way of Beersheba lives,’ they*ld shall fall, and never rise again.”
Amos 9
The Destruction of Israel

I*p saw the Lord standing beside the altar, and he said: “Strike*pn the capitals until the thresholds shake, and*ld shatter them on the heads of all the people; and*ln those who are left of them I will kill with the sword; not*ld one of them shall flee away; not*ld one of them shall escape.
“If*pn they dig into Sheol, from*ld there shall my hand take them; if*ln they climb up to heaven, from*ld there I will bring them down.

If*ln they hide themselves on the top of Carmel, from*ld there I will search them out and take them; and*ln if they hide from my sight at the bottom of the sea, there*ld I will command the serpent, and it shall bite them.
And*ln if they go into captivity before their enemies, there*ld I will command the sword, and it shall kill them; and*ln I will fix my eyes upon them for*ld evil and not for good.”
The*pn Lord God*s of hosts, he*ln who touches the earth and it melts, and*ld all who dwell in it mourn, and*ln all of it rises like the Nile, and*ld sinks again, like the Nile of Egypt;

who*ln builds his upper chambers in the heavens and*ld founds his vault upon the earth; who*ln calls for the waters of the sea and*ld pours them out upon the surface of the earth— the*ln Lord*s is his name.

“Are*pn you not like the Cushites to me, O*ld people of Israel?” declares the Lord.*s “Did*ln I not bring up Israel from the land of Egypt, and*ld the Philistines from Caphtor and the Syrians from Kir?

Behold,*ln the eyes of the Lord God*s are upon the sinful kingdom, and*ld I will destroy it from the surface of the ground, except*ld that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,” declares*l the Lord.*s
“For*pn behold, I will command, and*ld shake the house of Israel among all the nations as*ln one shakes with a sieve, but*ld no pebble shall fall to the earth.
All*ln the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, who*ld say, ‘Disaster shall not overtake or meet us.’
The Restoration of Israel
“In*pn that day I will raise up the*ld booth of David that is fallen and*ln repair its breaches, and*ld raise up its ruins and*ld rebuild it as in the days of old,
that*ln they may possess the remnant of Edom and*ld all the nations who are called by my name,” declares*ld the Lord*s who does this.

“Behold,*pn the days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “when*ld the plowman shall overtake the reaper and*ld the treader of grapes him who sows the seed; the*ln mountains shall drip sweet wine, and*ld all the hills shall flow with it.

I*ln will restore the fortunes of my people Israel, and*ld they shall rebuild the ruined cities and inhabit them; they*ln shall plant vineyards and drink their wine, and*ld they shall make gardens and eat their fruit.
I*ln will plant them on their land, and*ld they shall never again be uprooted out*ld of the land that I have given them,” says*l the Lord*s your God.
